epp:phrases.epp:phrase: If appropriate fill out the fields to map a geographical bounding box where this data was collected. If you do not have this information or do not think it is relevant simply leave the field fields blank.
Longitude of the eastern-most point of an imaginary square placed around the sample area for the data collection.

Alternative title of the data collection. The title should not end with a full stop, but may end with a question mark. If there is a subtitle, it should be preceded with a colon [:]. Use capitals only for the first word and for proper nouns.
Latitude of the northern-most point of an imaginary square placed around the sample area for the data collection.
Latitude of the southern-most point of an imaginary square placed around the sample area for the data collection.
Latitude of the western-most point of an imaginary square placed around the sample area of the data collection.
Describe the methodology used to create this data collection, including information on the studied population, studied entities and sampling procedures.
If applicable, enter the grant number or identifier for this research or its parent project.
Information about the source of any data or data element not derived from previous work, and any changes made to this data prior to deposit.
You may stipulate any specific requirements or limitations for re-use of this resource here.
Enter, if applicable, either the geographic region(s) in which your data collection was carried out (e.g. name of country, region, location) or the spatial reference system used.
Statement on legal, ethical and access issues
Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council
Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council
Enter keywords or phrases that best describe this data collection, separated by commas (,)
Please select an appropriate data type(s) for this data collection. If a suitable category is not listed, select 'Other'.
Enter any additional external resources that relate to this data collection.
Enter any additional accreditation you wish to give for the production of this data collection.
The organisation or public body that funded the research responsible for generating this data collection.
The time period (start and end date) for collection of the data, e.g. dates of fieldwork.
The time period (start and end date) for this data collection, if it is different from the data collection period, e.g. for data representing a historical period.

Enter a description of any legal, ethical issues encountered in generating the data, and how these have been dealt with in order to allow sharing, including access restrictions in place. Example: risk of disclosing participants' identities was mitigated by removing references to real names and other identifying information.
Language of any written material in the data collection.
Use this field for any useful information about your data collection that can't be entered anywhere else. This information will appear on the public summary page for this deposit.
If this data collection was created as part of a larger project, then indicate the title of this parent project here. This will enable the relational linking of multiple data collections.
Please state here whether your deposit has been published (or is currently in the process of being published) prior to deposit here.
Original publication URL for this data collection.
State the copyright holding individuals and/or organisations for the data collection.
The content of this data file or document. If you are uploading zipped bundles of files then please select 'Mixed', or 'Full Archive' if the bundle contains all the files in this collection.
Enter a brief description of this item.
You may set an embargo period for this item, which will then not be available for download until the date specified.

The title of the data collection. The title should not end with a full stop, but may end with a question mark. If there is a subtitle, it should be preceded with a colon [:]. Use capitals only for the first word and for proper nouns.
Example: A brief history of time
Example: Life: an unauthorised biography
Example: Mathematics for engineers and scientists. 5th edition
Example: Ecosystems of the world. Vol. 26. Estuaries of the world
A written description of the data collection. If the data collection has an abstract then this should be entered here.

Please select at least one main subject category, and optionally up to two other subject categories you think are appropriate for your submission, from the list below. Please note that there may not be a perfect fit for your particular subject area - please select the closest match or a high level term.
The university department with which this data collection should be associated.

Enter names and details of creators (or authors) in the format indicated below. If this data collection has been published, all authors should be listed here. If there are more than four creators, click on the [More input rows] button.
Example: [Smith] [J.P.] [j.smith@soton.ac.uk]
Example: [Chance-Collins] [Chris] [chris@bar.com]
Example: [Fu] [Yan-Li] []
Example: [von Höpfner] [Ludwig G.] []
Companies or other corporate bodies that were involved in the creation of this data collection e.g. an external laboratory.
Please select an appopriate data type(s) found within this collection. If a suitable category is not listed, select 'Other'.
Enter details of related resources. E.g. publications based on this data.

If this data collection has been published prior to deposit here, please state by whom. Do not use abbreviations, enter in full.
Example: Oxford University Press
If this data collection has been published prior to deposit here, please provide an associated date of release.

If there are access restrictions on any of the data files or documents in this collection, requests to view and access these items will be sent to this email address. The email address will not be made public.
Enter any information or comments for the repository editorial staff. This information will not be displayed in the public record of the data collection.

Selecting a security level will determine who is able to download this document. If you set this to anything other than "Anyone" then consider adding a contact email for this collection (on the next page of this deposit process); this will allow users to request a copy of the document through a web form and you to grant access at your discretion.

td.p: If this is your first time depositing, or if you require more information on any aspect of the deposit process, you may wish to view our Help page.

epp:phrase.p: Click the Browse button below to select a file and the Upload button to upload it to the repository. If you are uploading a large number of files, you may find uploading and describing each file separately cumbersome. In these situations we suggest you upload the files in logically grouped zip bundles instead.
Please note that your progress will automatically be saved when you click 'Next' or 'Save and Return' above. Clicking 'Cancel' will result in the loss of any changes since last save.
The orange star symbol indicates a mandatory field.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: A file embargo date cannot be more than 12 months in the future.
Please select the storage format of this data file, bundle or document.
Specify an explicit license for this document (does not effect the access rights you grant at the end of this deposit process). This repository allows Creative Commons and Open Data Commons licenses.
If this item has been given a Digital Object Identifier (DOI) when published elsewhere, please include it here.
The language of the metadata record stored in this repository.
The action to be taken on arrival at the retention date.
A comment on the retention conditions of this item.
The date until which this item will be retained in the repository.
